Reviews.Content: Let's start with the door handle that came off in my hand. DON'T STAY HERE. This hotel bills itself a 3 star--not even close. I've stayed in many budget hotels in Italy that were far superior. First, the physical plant is simply worn out. Our traveling companions were moved to another hotel because the door and door frame to their room completely collapsed when they tried to unlock it. Needless to say, we didn't feel all that safe behind our door.The bedspreads were threadbare. The furniture was circa 1980 plastic kitsch, complete with some sort of stereo console between the beds that didn't work. The wall art would have been right at home at a yard sale. There was extra wall art--graffitti apparently drawn by previous inmates. My favorite was the bunny rabbit cartoon. The bathroom door handle came off in my hand. The towel racks were the white tubular plastic kind, and falling off the wall--we didn't even try to hand towels on them. Small trickle of tepid water for shower. The toilet had a formica-covered tank and a push-button flush that worked about 1 out of 3 pushes. The clean bath towels were stacked IN THE BIDET! Yuck.For fairness's sake: the staff were friendly and the breakfast was quite nice (except for the coffee out of a 7/11 machine). But you can do far, far better for the money.
Reviews.Author: cantucci

Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel of my Life I have been visiting Florence every year for 20 years and this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in by far. Hotels can be expensive in Florence and it is difficult to find a comfortable hotel for a good price in this city. However, most hotels have their own charm This hotel, however, had no redeeming features whatsoever. It was very dirty, many things in the room were broken and the staff were unsympathetic when I complained. For, example, the room had a badly broken window with exposed glass, the sink was cracked, the fridge did not work, the air conditioning did not work at all, carpets and curtains were very badly stained, there was no hot water and all the cupboards / wardrobes were broken. For the second night I asked for a different room, but it also had the same problems other than the broken window. This is a filthy, disgusting hotel that should not be allowed to continue to operate. It certainly does not deserve the 3 stars it caries and is giving Florence a bad name by its very existence. The staff seemed surprised when I complained and were unhelpful. I did get half my money back via the web site that I used to book the hotel, but my stay had been ruined.
Reviews.Author: Visiting_Professor2

Reviews.Content: You have to shower over the toilet?!?! Don't let any of the photos on the website fool you. Photoshop is a wonderful thing! Temperatures were freezing and below outside and we had no heat. My sisters were sleeping in hats and coats. There was graffiti on the dingy walls in our hotel rooms and the smell of the rooms and halls was awful... almost as if a sewer had backed up. Half of the lights in the rooms did not work, the outlets did not work, and the mattresses had holes in them. There was hair all over our sheets. The bathrooms were spectacular, though, they were so small you had to shower over the toilet. The shower in one of our three rooms flooded the entire hotel room and the staff was completely indifferent. They did not even come to the room to look at the problem. You would be better off sleeping on the sidewalk.
Reviews.Author: tootse318

Reviews.Content: You are better off sleeping on a park bench This hotel is dirty. There were hairs on the bathroom sink when we checked in. The towels were left in the bidet. There was a film of dirt on the night tables and hair in the bed sheets. The night clerk assured us she would get us into a sister hotel the next night. We had paid in advance so we lost money but refused to sleep in this mess. We booked into the nearby Rivoli. The next day we went to the sister hotel and the lobby was dirty and the clerk crabby. We left and went back to the Rivoli. This hotel cost us an extra 500 Euro because we had to pay for a second hotel. Dont waste your money. No travel agent should book this place. You are better sleeping on a park bench!.
Reviews.Author: werSurrey

Reviews.Content: do not stay here whatever you do on our arrival we should have perhaps found it charming that we were supplied with our own tv remote-which they keep behind the recpetion desk in case they go missing. First alarm bell rang when we went to the lift-which cannot have passed an safety cert for sometime-we were worried we might not make it to our floor!. The majority of our floor was cordoned off and water was leaking onto towels left on the floor-not even a bucket had been left to capture the water. The room was stuffy and smelly and on trying the bathroom facilities we found that not only did the shower (which hung over the toilet) did not work, neither did the toilet.The concierge told us he did not have another room available untill morning and we had to argue to say we would not stay there. He then arranged for us to move to the Ambasciatori round the corner and said he would have a room available for us the following day. We advised we would not be returning and left. The impression we got is that this is a common occurence as the second concierge at the Ambasciatori did not seem at all surprised to hear of our troubles. Happily we were upgraded for the remainder of our stay in Florence, but unless you want to go through the hassle we did to get a good room for less, do not book at this hotel.
Reviews.Author: charlie_12123

Reviews.Content: Not a three star! The location is excellent but thats about it the room wasn't ready when we arrived and not a three star quality, two single beds pushed together and they weren't even comfortable.The room was very very basic but the staff are friendly and the reception is 24 hour which is handy, I'd go back to Florence but wouldn't stay there again.
Reviews.Author: JoeyBlue

Reviews.Content: Not worth the prize! We selected this hotel just by its location!It is next to the main railway station. The prize was about 100 Euros per night and we thought that it was okay for the season.The moment we got in the property, reception was not up to the mark, the hotel has really old feel, you can say, its out dated. Rooms are with high ceiling but very old, and they look much older by the furniture and carpets on the floor. Our bathroom leaked on to the carpets the first night so we changed the room, still the same story, old, old n smelling old everywhere. Though the bathroom was okay!Break fast is as usual in these types of hotels and it is complementry. We stayed for 2 nights but it was really disapointing. This hotel needs an immediate make over!People, I will tell you a simple thing. Florence looks very beautiful with its structures, museums, the Duomo, shopping but after the busy n hectic day trip, when you want to have a good night sleep, you enter this hotel and the mood become so depresing that all the charm of Florence vanishes in seconds.Please select something else to preserve your memories of Florence, The City!
Reviews.Author: vikasvp

Reviews.Content: stinks a lot...will never book it again ! Now the name of the hotel- BH Hotels Club.Well, what can I say...before booking a room at this hotel, read all the reviews and take them into consideration.3 stars...how funny. Don't believe the official description of the hotel as it was said many times before. I stayed there only 1 night but it was enough to make a conclusion I stayed at the worst hotel I ever stayed at my life.The SMELL...the stink of the rooms is really UNBEARABLE!!! It kills all the advantages of the hotel (very close to railway station, 5 minutes walk to the heart of the city, check-in before 12, normal breakfast...). Apart from it was unbearable to stay in the room and sleep, all my bags and clothes have absorbed this monstrous smell. Even after my 15-days trip around Italy-Spain, when I came back home, all my clothes and other stuff in my bags stinked like BH Hotels Club, reminding me of that terrible place in a beautiful Florence.Besides, it was rather noisy at night as it's close to busy street; the shower was situated right above a toilet tank..so you have to choose either toilet or shower (which makes everything in the bathroom wet!); Internet - very expensive; fridge didn't work...
Reviews.Author: Irch

Reviews.Content: Pure fiction This hotel's description is pure fiction. We asked for (and got) a ground floor room- turned out to be the only groundfloor room. Wish we'd read this website before we booked it. No bar, no TV lounge, sullen female reception staff, no minibar, fridge that couldn't be plugged in because socket was bust, radio alarm gubbins broken and its faceplate screwed onto headboard upside down, dodgy shower/bath control, leaky plug in bath, very tatty bedcover, and oh yes, a very funny smell!However, the bed was comfy and the breakfast good.There were still adverts on the wall for Happy Hour and Live Music in Bar etc- when we queried this we were told by a very surly female No Bar. Website photos do not describe this hotel at all accurately. It's a star-less dump!Work still going on while we were there - they need a magician, not a welder!!
Reviews.Author: popeye999

Reviews.Content: All I can say is Urine First of all, they advertise AC...Sweet Mother of God...there was none...only running heat. I would rather stay in a hostel than this place. Aside from the springs in the bed, no working shower and carpet that smelled like urine (maybe from us in our disgust in the elevator) The bathroom consisted of a floor meant to be the whole shower floor - all I can is YUCK. We wore towels on our head like turbans all the time just to keep cool. Don't let the photos deceive you - the photos were taken 20 years ago. Buyer Beware.
Reviews.Author: The_Cougar

Reviews.Content: Avoid this place!       Front of the hotel
Reviews.Author: BluEyesofJoy

Reviews.Content: So Bad We Checked Out! This hotel should not be even operating. Apparently it's 3*. Joke! It shouldn't even have 1*. Firstly don't be fooled by the somewhat clean if dated appearance of the reception area. It gets so much worse. We were in a group so were occupying 3 rooms in total. Each one was worst than the other. In our room the air con wasn't working; it was 43 degrees outside. We could not open the window as it was overlooking a noisy street. The decor was so badly dated. The bed was a camp-bed, no more than that. The sheets were stained. The paintwork on the walls was in need of attention. The carpet was so dirty I would not walk around in my bare feet. At one point, whilst walking around the bed, I realised that I had walked into a hole in the ground which had been covered over by the carpet without being fixed. In our companions room next door the air con was working alright but when you turned it on it sounding like a 747 taking off. The carpet was soaking wet outside the en-suite door where there was obviously a leak that had not been attended too. The stink in the room was unbearable. None of us slept that night because it was so hot and grubby. The next morning we went down for breakfast. It was truly awful too, not even edible. We had booked in for 4 nights but decided we couldn't possibly cope with it any longer as it was so horrendous. Initially the hotel staff were hostile when we informed them of our decision. But when we listed our complaints they agreed to contact the online agent who we booked through. Notably the receptionist seemed to be quite familiar with the online agent as they were speaking over the phone. It was then suggested to us that we be upgraded to the hotel's 4* sister hotel around the corner and a member of the staff would take us around to the hotel to see if we were happy with it. We agreed to that. There was no comparison between the two. What a difference 1* makes in Italy!. We moved immediately and it saved what could have been a disaster of a stay in Florence. Had we checked Trip Advisor before we booked it could have saved us a lots of hassle!! Don't even be tempted to book this hotel at the last minute, you will really regret it.!
Reviews.Author: Irish_Rover_07

Reviews.Content: Mixed experience Went there with a group--we had a very OK room. Our room needed updating desperately, but it was at least clean and the mini-fridge kept our beverages cool. One of the other people in our party had a hole in the floor that was covered up by the carpet. Some in our party thought the rooms were not very clean and had artwork missing from their walls. The location is great, especially those traveling to multiple locations w/in Italy because of the nearby bus and train stations. But the individual rooms are pretty hit or miss, it seemed.
Reviews.Author: Derky17

Reviews.Content: Terrible-----!!!!!! How many springs are in a mattress??? gee counting how many were sticking into my back the night i had to stay there last year, i would say 7!the carpet was disgusting, the bathroom was dirty, the walls were all scuffed up. it's located in that neighborhood next to the train station, the noisiest neighborhood in town. thank god I found a nice apartment to stay in for this year's trip. my advice to anyone visiting Florence would be to internet search for vacation rentals (apartments). try craiglist, or holiday-rentals.com. we stayed in a very nice apartment on the south side of town this past february called casa spinelli, we found it on craigslist. check out there website:[----]
Reviews.Author: Kathymarie7

Reviews.Content: It's not bad, but not great 飩?The hotel is in the middle of being refurbished therefore loose wires here, there and everywhere.飩?Strange smell on a night in the downstairs area (drains).飩?Room was cold during the day.飩?There were ants in the dining area.飩?The mini bar in our room was broken and leaking water. 飩?Do not rely on their wake up call we asked for one but never received it.飩?The advertised entertainment on a night does not exist and the bar is never open.飩?Walls are paper thin, you hear everyone coming and going.However鈥?飩?Breakfast was nice, wide range to choose from. 飩?The staff were friendly.飩?Good central location.飩?Rooms were clean.
Reviews.Author: lalaEngland

Reviews.Content: Smelly carpet but good location Yes the red carpet throughout the hotel corridors and outside our bathroom in our room does smell - a combination of mustiness and dampness. I put a towel on the carpet outside our bathroom door which immediately removed the offending smell though! The buffet breakfast is quite good (especially the oat clusters cereal), location near Santa Maria Novella station is excellent, room/linen was clean and staff were friendly and helpful to us.
Reviews.Author: Yaro

Reviews.Content: Great Staff After getting to Firenze very late and not able to get a train out till the next day my daughter and I went to a few other hotels that were book and had no rooms something was going on in town that week. We came upon the Club and the staff went out of their way to help us and we stayed for three days in Firenze it was great. Yes the stairs are crazy and they were working on the hotel but its the little thing that make a trip great. By the way the bath was hot and wounderful after a day out.
Reviews.Author: Lalafayette

Reviews.Content: Some good but mostly horrible
Reviews.Author: travller_with_kids

Reviews.Content: Not bad hotel - great location This hotel is located really centrally so means that everything is in walking distance. It is however, basic. We had a twin room with bathroom. The beds looked odd (like camp beds) but were in fact comfy and although the rest of the furniture and carpets looked tired, they were clean.Breakfast left a lot to be desired, but instead of the ropey instant coffee they try and foist on you, ask for an espresso and they'll make one from the machine in the bar (this is what the Itallian tourists were doing whilst the rest of us made do!). Alternatively, the cafe/bar or the corner nextt o the hotel is great for pastries/coffee/sandwiches etc.All in all, not a bad hotel - how long do you spend in your room when you're visiting a city anyway? Yes, in an ideal world it would be more up to date and luxurious, but then it would be more expensive.
Reviews.Author: Sammiet

Reviews.Content: So gross you had to laugh Reception was friendly but obviusly not schooled in hotel management. The elevator is a teeny box that dosen't reach all the floors--you have to negotiate a weird series of staircases otherwise--and the carpet is disgusting everywhere: halls, rooms, etc. Our a/c was so loud we joked there must be a couple of guys running on a treadmill somewhere in the attic keeping it going--but when it started leaking the second day and water had flooded part of our carpet we insisted on a different room. Second room better, but still disturbingly seedy. Heard from mgmt. there was recent new ownership and changes being made, but am dubious. Gross, all in all.
Reviews.Author: lostbaggage

Reviews.Content: Good location Having originally booked into the Hotel Airone and finding it extremely unsatisfactory, we popped into the Club Hotel to reserve a room for our remaining two nights (out of three). We chose this hotel due to its location - across the road from the bus/train station (without looking directly onto it) and within walking distance of all attractions. The room was very basic but clean enough. The carpets did look a bit grubby and the room was quite dark. Minibar had nothing in it. Bathroom was clean enough and had a shower over a small bath. Breakfast was basic but fine - cereals, yoghurt, rolls, croissants, pastries etc. - the usual fare. Not too keen on the ants on the floor of the breakfast area, however. All staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. A bit expensive for the standard of room (we paid 240 Euros for a double room for two nights) but we were glad we moved due to its location. And it was certainly miles better than the Hotel Airone!!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Health and safety issues I am surprised that this hotel is allowed to stay open in Florence. Its carpets appear and smell of 18th century dust and I had a bad respiratory infection as a result. Have Italians no standards besides a dress code. Inspite of all the hype of Tuscan well being and culture, this hotel has let us down. Can the Italian authorities not be informed of such poor standards.I have seen several bad remarks about this hotel only after I came back and I am surprised that the same still continues. It appears that the few good reviews could be the lucky ones or the hotel staff posting themKen barbosa
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Great Bargain - Hotel Club Florence If you want a basic hotel centrally located in Florence, this is the place for you. As a middle-aged female professor traveling alone, I felt totally safe in this hotel. The clientele seemed to be mostly families and small groups, and it was never noisy. The rooms are Spartan -- I had a twin bed, but there was an armoire, a desk, color TV, and air conditioning that worked. The rooms are soundproof. The shower in the bathroom is basically part of the floor, but I never had problems with flooding because it is slightly indented. Bathrooms are small, including the shower, toilet, bidet and sink. The hotel staff was wonderful - they all speak English fluently, and the cleaning staff is great. Breakfast (more than the usual continental) was free. Perhaps most of all, the location is phenomenal. It is directly next to the bus station for those wanting to take tours -- or go to the airport. It is right across the street from the train station. Anything in Florence is within walking distance. I would stay at this hotel again. If you want a luxury hotel, this is not for you -- but if you're in Florence, you shouldn't be spending all your time in a hotel room!
Reviews.Author: ProfT

Reviews.Content: Do Not Read A Book From Its Cover i would say that the hotel is at a great location, it is only 10mins walk and you could reach the attraction and the shopping areas and 2 mins walk and you could reach the train station. While, the room has horified me and my husband.the window was damaged, the air con was not functioning during summer time, the bathroom is smelly. the bed was dirty, oh goohs, that was the worst hotel i could ever had.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Skip This Hotel, Please! This is absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! First of all the lady at the desk was arrogant and rude, the room filthy, no air conditioning and the street was so busy and noisy if the window was opened (not to mention there was some sort of food stand outside with a guy frying up meat at all hours). We complained so they showed my husband how to go flip the switch on the breaker so we'd have electricity. We are not fussy people, but this place was total, total crap. Please avoid it if necessary!!
Reviews.Author: angoragoat

Reviews.Content: Great location Somehow I didn't encounter the disgusting rooms that others have experienced. The room and bathroom were quite clean as far as we're concerned, and none of the smell mentioned by others whatsoever. The receptionist wasn't exactly friendly but from my experience with Italians, it's not atypical. The upside is that it's literally within 1 min walk from the train station so the location's superb for those who arrive in a late train (we arrived at 10-ish pm?) and who need to catch a train (we left the hotel 15 min before the departure time and were still on time, somewhat). We needed to ask them for breakfast though, although it's included. Considering the price (~60 euros a night for 2), it's not bad overall for the ones with budget.
Reviews.Author: scyw

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and Good Location I really liked this hotel. Simple but in a good location, very convenient and nice people are working there. Very helpfull.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: absolutely horrible! I stayed at this hotel on a tour with friends... our room was so disgusting, it was like something out of a movie. Someone had used the bathroom in our room and not flushed the toilet, so our whole room smelled as soon as we opened the bathroom door. I sat down on the bed and saw a bug crawling across the bedspread. There was also, I kid you not, a bag of garbage under the bed. We complained and were moved to another room, but I didn't even get under the covers of my bed. It was by far the nastiest place I have ever stayed in my entire life. Thank God we were only there one night!
Reviews.Author: marymaria

Reviews.Content: Every bit as bad   showReview(4352076, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great location but thats all   showReview(4157975, 'full');
Reviews.Author: excited05

Reviews.Content: Dont go   showReview(4153215, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Great location, but ...!   showReview(4045793, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Shabby, but quite well located   showReview(3983646, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else   showReview(3983049, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Florence is too beautiful to worry too much about a room

Reviews.Content: 銇嗐倧銇曢€氥倞椐呫亱銈夌洿杩?..   showReview(20347737, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
